text: The old Morgue, 400 East 29th Street, at S. E. corner of First Avenue. This will be replaced by a six story building. About 1905.

First Avenue, north from E. 29th Street, showing mainly the easterly side of this thoroughfare above 30th Street (seen on the right).  The smoke stacks seen in the distance are atop the N.Y. Steam Co. plant and the Consolidated Edison Company generating unit.  Note the 34th Street "El" spur crossing the Avenue.  Exclusive of the removal of the latter feature, this view in 1936 remains the same.
No. 2 shows only a portion of the area seen in View No. 1 Note at the right the clearance (shown solely in View No. 3) where the present Psychopathic Hospital unit of the Bellevue stands.
September 10, 1928.
Views 2 & 3: April 27, 1930.
P.L. Sperr

First Avenue, north from E. 29th Street, showing mainly the easterly side of this thoroughfare above 30th Street (seen on the right).  The smoke stacks seen in the distance are atop the N.Y. Steam Co. plant and the Consolidated Edison Company generating unit.  Note the 34th Street "El" spur crossing the Avenue.  Exclusive of the removal of the latter feature, this view in 1936 remains the same.
No. 2 shows only a portion of the area seen in View No. 1 Note at the right the clearance (shown solely in View No. 3) where the present Psychopathic Hospital unit of the Bellevue stands.
September 10, 1928.
Views 2 & 3: April 27, 1930.
P.L. Sperr

First Avenue, north from E. 29th Street, showing mainly the easterly side of this thoroughfare above 30th Street (seen on the right).  The smoke stacks seen in the distance are atop the N.Y. Steam Co. plant and the Consolidated Edison Company generating unit.  Note the 34th Street "El" spur crossing the Avenue.  Exclusive of the removal of the latter feature, this view in 1936 remains the same.
No. 2 shows only a portion of the area seen in View No. 1 Note at the right the clearance (shown solely in View No. 3) where the present Psychopathic Hospital unit of the Bellevue stands.
September 10, 1928.
Views 2 & 3: April 27, 1930.
P.L. Sperr

29th Street, south side, west from 330 East 29th, west of First Avenue. In the left centre is the parochial school of the Carmelite Roman Catholic Church. June 24, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

29th Street, south side, east of First Avenue, with a clearing on the north side, showing the Bellevue Hospital laundry and other buildings.

April 27, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

29th Street, north side, east of First Avenue, looking across the future site of the Psychopathic Hospital to the lumber yard on the north side of 30th Street.
April 30, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

Fidelio Brewery, 29th Street at, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of First Avenue. The S.W. corner of First avenue and
29th Street is shown at the left.
April 31, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

Bellevue Hospital: A view showing the southern side of the Morgue Building; which is located at the S.E. corner of First Ave., and East 29th Street.

February 4, 1937.

W.P.A. Photo.
City Wide Project.
title: Hospitals - Bellevue Hospital - [The morgue building.]
